sentence: When you get an “F” on an exam and your friend says, “Nice job, Einstein.”
explanation: "In this case the friend is using the phrase "Nice job Einstein" to sarcastically mock the person for getting an "F" on the exam. The use of "Einstein a famous scientist associated with intelligence, is intended to highlight the person's failure in a sarcastic manner.

sentence: “I love that dress. The design really highlights your double chin.”
explanation: "This sentence is sarcastic because it appears to be a compliment about the dress but actually points out a perceived flaw the double chin. The intention is to mockingly criticize the dress under the guise of a compliment.”
